txt.en: <rgb=#FF0000>Sit</rgb> and be with your family that is no longer with you

Your family can be found throughout the Vales of Anduin.

You should greet your family members with a <rgb=#00FF00>hug</rgb> whenever you find them among the Vales.

<rgb=#FF0000>You will need to do much within the Vales in order to encounter all your relatives.</rgb>
<rgb=#FF0000>Sit</rgb> and be with your family that is no longer with you
Beorn's cave reminds you of family members that no longer roam the Vales

Your journey has been long, and the sight of your family is welcome after so long on the road. Your kinfolk among the Beornings are eager to see you and hear of your adventures. Greet them warmly and with the customary bear-hug of your people.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>You will need to do much within the Vales in order to encounter all your relatives.</rgb>
Home is where you find your family, and while your adventures bring you often away, you should take every opportunity to show them you care.

Beorn's cave can be found at the base of the Carrock in the Beorning-lands.\n\nYou should enter Beorn's cave, a site for remembering members of your family that no longer walk or roam among the Vales.
Beorn's cave can be found at the base of the Carrock in the Beorning-lands.\n\nInside the cave, you should sit for a moment in quiet contemplation.
You gave a thought to your family, and now that your heart and mind are at ease, you feel ready to continue your adventures.
<rgb=#FF0000>Sit</rgb> and be with your family that is no longer with you
Your extended family can be found throughout the Vales of Anduin, but the Beorninghús will be a good place to begin.
You thank Beorn and those of your family who have passed
Return to the Beorninghús to greet your family members
<rgb=#00FF00>Sit</rgb> in Beorn's cave and think of family members that have gone
You thank Beorn and those of your family who have passed
Enter Beorn's cave at the base of the Carrock
It is good to be home. Now that your heart and mind are at ease, you feel ready to continue your adventures, though your journeys bring you far away.
You give thanks to Beorn and others of your folk who have passed
